answers.answer: When was the last time you were checked for gestational diabetes?  The thirst symptom makes me think of it.

Well...I was checked when I was supposed to, right at 28 weeks. BUT...I was told she was going to let it slide. My number was 134. Some places that is fail. I should probably have them check me again. That's what I was thinking too.
I was going to suggest being retesting for gestational diabetes.   Your symptoms don't seem normal to me but of course I'm not a Dr.    Have you called the clinic?

maybe I'm confused and if so I apologize in advance but didn't you have high blood pressure a few wks ago but nothing showed in your urine?  The constant headache could be a sign of pre eclampsia (sorry- can't spell today)  you don't have blurred vision or swelling right now do you?

Yes, I did have high BP, but it went down. I was thinking that, too. I do have more of a risk with this pregnancy because I had it with my first pregnancy and this is my first pregnancy with my partner. I just don't know if it's normal or not. I just put a call in to a nurse. This headache has been bad. Not normal for me, but could be just a normal pregnancy complaint. I just don't know. I've had some swelling, but nothing too bad. I guess it wouldn't hurt to have them check my urine for protein and sugar to rule both out. I'm just feeling like such a complainer!
I had a severe headache when my blood pressure went high with my last pregnancy.  I would call and go in.  Good luck.

Better off being a whiner/complainer and having nothing wrong then to sit back and assume all is normal and then have it turn out to be serious.Hoping all is ok and you're just a whiner!!!!!!!!!!   Let us know what the Dr says.
;) Me too.Man, this pregnancy is kicking my a s s...

Pregnancy can definately be hard on you.  My friend is 38 and 18 wks pregnant. She was 29 when she had her other child and says she doesn't remember being so worn out. I  was 28 and 32 when I had my kids.  By the end of the day I was so exhausted I didn't think I'd make it.

My definite first thought was gestational diabetes. I would talk to your doctor about it. If it gets too out of hand there are things they NEED to do for you and the baby. Gestational diabetes left untreated can also cause the baby to be born with diabetes as well. It's just over all not good. Please talk to your doctor.

question: Okay, in the past three days I have had quite a severe throbbing headache, despite drinking lots of water and taking Tylenol. Neither helps. Not only that, despite drinking lots of water, I still have excessive thirst. Can't get enough. Frequent urination also, which I guess makes sense with late pregnancy. I have had an aching in my mid back right where I know my right kidney is, but yet a urine specimen done just monday came back negative. It is a throbbing. So:Severe headacheExcessive thirstFrequent urinationFlank painAny ideas? Or does this just seem normal? It doesn't feel normal. But I have been such a whiner lately to my doctor about my discomforts with sore ribs and basic discomforts, I thought I would ask here first. I can't get rid of this headache and I can't seem to drink enough water to quench my thirst.
title: Any ideas or is it just normal?
